events.message: The customer reported an auto accident that occurred on April 30th involving their vehicle rear-ending another car at a stoplight.
The claim has been reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident category due to keywords such as vehicle, collision, and accident in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the claim process and provide updates on assessment.
The customer received formal acknowledgment from the insurer confirming the auto accident claim has been officially registered.
The insurance company requested police reports, photographs of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed with investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report, collision photos, and mechanic's repair estimates for claim evaluation.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and details about the car collision to verify claim validity.
Investigation on the auto accident claim was completed confirming liability and extent of vehicle damage as documented.
Based on investigation results, a settlement amount was proposed to cover repairs and any related costs for the car accident.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and requested a prompt disbursement of the settlement funds.
The claim was formally approved by claims management authorizing payment to cover vehicle repair based on agreed settlement.
Payment was issued to the customer's designated account to cover expenses related to the recent auto collision claim.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after successful settlement payment and customer confirmation of issue resolution.
The entire claim file was archived in the insurance database for future reference and regulatory compliance purposes.
